"It was a time of great uncertainty, and there was little confidence in the government. There was little confidence in the intelligence community. And there was little confidence in the public. One of the best things that happened was that for the first time in the history of the United States, the American people began to listen to what was happening in the world... And the American people began to realize what happened to nuclear Iran... And that's what created the great fear in the world, the fear of the Iranian people, and the fear of the American people that this was going to happen. And so there was a great deal of uncertainty.
